header.title: Outsourcing — Overview
header.subtitle: Overview of all documents relating to outsourcing
header.abstract: Integration of proofing tools with commercial applications like Adobe InDesign and Microsoft Office is very time consuming and errouneous without experience and former practice. It has thus been decided as the most cost-effective solution to outsource these tasks. — This document gives an overview of all documents relating to the outsourcing.

section.title: Background information
section.p: Below is a list of documents, information and templates useful for outsourcing through an open competition (public tender) within the rules of EEC/EU.

ul.li: Guide to regulations on public investments (the title is a free translation, the original title as well as the whole document are in Norwegian)
Contact points for questions relating to public tenders (in Norwegian)
Best practises - a guide to public tenders (in Norwegian)
Template for Public Tender Document (MS Word document)

section.title: The Competition Process
section.p: The round of public tender (the competition) is held according to rules by the Norwegian government, and is in accordance with EU/EEC regulations. The following is the planned schedule and process (the dates may still shift):

ol.li: Selection criterion, the exact list of deliveries and the schedule will be decided by the project board at their meeting October 4th
The public tender will be opened about two months after the project board meeting (suggestion: November 20th)
There might be a deadline for expressing interest in giving an offer, cf this document, chapter 9.7.

Attending companies should deliver their offer within the deadline, which is minimum 52 days after the public tender has been opened (if opened at November 20th, the deadline would be at earliest January 11th)

The offers received will be ranked according to the selection criterias published with the tender, and the ranked list will be presented to the board, who makes the decision on which company/-ies to outsource to
The decision will be made public at latest 48 days after the deadline for the offers. If the offer deadline is January 11th, the decision will be made public no later than February 28th
The deadline for [å overklage] the decision is YY days after the decision has been made public
The expiration date for the offers is 6 months after the deadline for the public tender

section.p: This process and its schedule will be reviewed and finally decided upon by the project board.

section.title: The Public Tender Documents
section.p: The background and supporting documents regarding the public tender are listed below. This list will be expanded and the documents refined until the tender documentation is complete, at latest by the time of publication of the public tender.

ul.li: Public Tender Main Document - the main document, also containing details and background info regaring the other documents below.
Qualification criterias - the minimum requirements to be able to participate in the round of public tender
Selection criterias - the rules according to which the given offers will be ranked

Deliverables - exact list of deliverables, both obligatory and optional parts. The optionality is on our side: we will have the possibility to decide later that we in the end will do certain parts ourselves, depending on the offers received, and the implementation suggested by the vendors.
Requirements specification - the complete set of requirements to the deliverables, and their specification

section.title: Contract
section.p: The public tender process will be concluded with signing a contract with the successful company/-ies. A candidate contract template (MS Word and PDF, both English) is provided by Statskonsult.
